summary: This is a legal filing from the civil case against Ghislaine Maxwell (15-cv-07433-RWS). It contains Maxwell's formal responses and objections to the plaintiff's second set of document requests. The document reveals defense strategies, including objections on privilege and relevance grounds, and references to joint defense agreements, communications with other figures, and the plaintiff's background.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the civil lawsuit who is responding to the plaintiff's document requests. She objects to numerous requests on grounds of privilege, relevance, and burden.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Repeatedly referenced in document requests concerning joint defense agreements, communications, contracts, and his association with Maxwell. Maxwell's responses object to producing related documents on privilege grounds.

persons.name: Alan Dershowitz
persons.context: Named in document requests regarding potential joint defense agreements and communications between his counsel and Maxwell's counsel. Maxwell's response indicates withholding some communications on privilege grounds.

persons.name: Ross Gow
persons.context: Referenced in requests concerning who paid for his work on Maxwell's behalf and statements made to the press. Maxwell objects to the requests.

persons.name: Laura A. Menninger
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell who signed and certified service of this response. She is with the firm Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C.

persons.name: Jeffrey S. Pagliuca
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell mentioned in the context of statements made during a March 21, 2016 meet and confer discussion. Maxwell claims to have no knowledge of his statements.

persons.name: Sigrid S. McCawley
persons.context: Attorney for the plaintiff listed on the certificate of service.

persons.name: Meridith Schultz
persons.context: Attorney for the plaintiff listed on the certificate of service.

persons.name: Paul G. Cassell
persons.context: Attorney for the plaintiff listed on the certificate of service.

connections.description: The document requests seek joint defense agreements and communications between them, indicating a legal and operational partnership relevant to the allegations of sexual abuse and trafficking.
Document requests seek joint defense agreements and communications between their attorneys, suggesting a coordinated legal defense strategy.
Gow performed work on Maxwell's behalf, and requests seek to identify who paid for his services.
Menninger is listed as an attorney for Maxwell and signed this legal filing on her behalf.
Pagliuca is an attorney for Maxwell, and his statements during a meet and confer are referenced in the document requests.

events.title: Meet and Confer Discussion
events.description: A discussion between legal teams where Maxwell's attorney, Jeffrey Pagliuca, allegedly made statements about the plaintiff's sexual assault allegations.

events.title: Filing of Discovery Responses
events.description: The date Ghislaine Maxwell's legal team filed these formal responses and objections to the plaintiff's second request for production of documents.

events.title: Alleged Abuse Period
events.description: The period referenced in the complaint during which the plaintiff alleges events pertaining to her and Ghislaine Maxwell occurred.

events.title: Referenced Statements Period
events.description: The period during which the complaint references statements attributed to Ghislaine Maxwell.

keyFacts: Maxwell's legal team asserts numerous objections to document requests, primarily based on attorney-client privilege, work-product doctrine, relevance, and burden.

The document reveals the plaintiff sought information on joint defense agreements between Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein, and between Maxwell and Alan Dershowitz, with Maxwell indicating she is withholding such documents on privilege grounds.
Maxwell states she has a 'practice of deleting emails after they have been read,' which is cited as an objection to the burden of recalling document dispositions.
The defense interprets the 'Relevant Period' for discovery narrowly, limiting it primarily to 1999-2002 and late 2014/early 2015, objecting to broader requests.
Maxwell's legal team indicates an intent to seek a protective order regarding her personal financial information, which was the subject of numerous document requests concerning punitive damages.
